intro: Alangium bogoriense, commonly known as the Borneo alangium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
